result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J Dietz

records.addlTxt: Arraignment set for 12/02/22 - not deliverable as addressed
Arraignment on December 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Motion hearing on December 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Additional Confidential Crime Victim Information. Filed by Prosecutor.
Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed by Atty Anne Renc
filed by the State
Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Motion to Modify Bond
Initial Appearance not yet held on this case

1:11 PM Defendant Christopher James Dietz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Return on Warrant in:  22CF320, 22CF301, 22CF160, 22CF142 & 21CF482.

BY THE COURT: 
All Warrants quashed on  22CF320, 22CF301, 22CF160, 22CF142 & 21CF482.

Attorney Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) states facts for anticipated charges of Theft - Intentionally Take, Felony Bail Jumping & Misdemeanor Bail Jumping.  
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.
Atty Anne Renc currently represents the defendant on other cases.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $2,500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 

Attorney for the defendant objects to cash bond and states reasons on the record.
Court sets a $1,500 cash bond to cover all cases listed above with conditions as stated on the record.

To Cover all Cases:
22GF414, 22CF320, 22CF301, 22CF160, 22CF142 and 21CF482.
Not be on the premises of Festival Foods
Comply with all open bond conditions

3:29 PM Defendant Christopher J Dietz not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State requests warrant for Defendant failing to appear for Court. 
Court questions the State for proper service. 
State informs the Court there was proper service. 
Court reviews the criminal complaint for probable cause. 
Court finds there is probable cause and grants the request for warrant.

BY THE COURT:
*  Warrant - body only

3:22 PM Defendant Christopher J Dietz not in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Christopher J Dietz.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
All files heard: 21CF482, 22CF142, 22CF160, 22CF301, 22CF320

Atty Dodge calls the cases and states the appearances.  Requests a body only warrant. 
Atty Renc has no information for the court. 
Atty Dodge makes additional statements regarding notice to the defendant. 
Court reviews each file for notice requirements. 
Court questions the parties regarding the notes from July 11. 
Atty Renc responds. 
Court notes notice was returned to the clerk's office.  

BY THE COURT: 
22CF320 was scheduled at 2:30 p.m. and parties advised he did not appear in Branch 2 for that case.  The parties are now in Branch 1. 
Court orders a warrant in each file and they will be body only. 

BY THE COURT:
BODY ONLY
filed by Atty Anne Renc
